title: How to Build a Bean Bag Game

steps.headline: Start with a 15" (38.1 cm) square of 1/4" (6.35 mm) plywood (or thinner-sized wood).
steps.description: If you want, have the local hardware store cut it for you if you don't feel confident enough to do it yourself.

steps.headline: Sand the edges down.
steps.description: This is to smooth out the ends to prevent anything from catching on them.

steps.headline: Paint the board background a solid color.
Cut the bottoms off five or six plastic cups about two inches (5 cm) high.
steps.description: Staple or nail the bottoms to the board in whatever arrangement you want. It is recommended to put one in each corner and one in the middle.

steps.headline: Paint a numerical value above the cup.
steps.description: Paint a "5" for each corner cup and a "10" for the middle cup.

steps.headline: Use a strong cloth for the beanbags.
steps.description: Cut the cloth into squares or rectangular shapes––probably 2 1/2" (6.35 cm) will be big enough for a square shape.

steps.headline: Sew around the square or rectangle, leaving enough room to pour in the beans.
steps.description: Pour the beans into each beanbag. Use a funnel to help if needed.

steps.headline: Then close the bag up with a few outside stitches.
steps.description: Ensure that it is tied off securely.

methods.name: Making rules for playing the game

steps.headline: Assign your own values to the cups and make your own rules for winning the game.
steps.description: You can make it short or long, depending on the number of "rounds" players want to toss through.
